/self.description: This holds the key (UUID, MMSI or URL) of this vessel, the actual data is in the vessels array.

/vessels.description: A wrapper object for vessel objects, each describing vessels in range, including this vessel.

/vessels/*.description: This regex pattern is used for validation of an MMSI or Signal K UUID identifier for the vessel. Examples: urn:mrn:imo:mmsi:230099999 urn:mrn:signalk:uuid:c0d79334-4e25-4245-8892-54e8ccc8021d

/vessels/*/url.description: URL based identity of the vessel, if available.

/vessels/*/mmsi.description: MMSI number of the vessel, if available.

/vessels/*/mothershipMmsi.description: MMSI number of the mothership of this vessel, if available.

/vessels/*/uuid.description: A unique Signal K flavoured maritime resource identifier, assigned by the server.

/vessels/*/name.description: The common name of the vessel

/vessels/*/flag.description: The country of ship registration, or flag state of the vessel

/vessels/*/port.description: The home port of the vessel

/vessels/*/registrations.description: The various registrations of the vessel.

/vessels/*/registrations/imo.description: The IMO number of the vessel.

/vessels/*/registrations/national.description: The national registration number of the vessel.

/vessels/*/registrations/national/RegExp.description: This regex pattern is used for validating the identifier for the registration

/vessels/*/registrations/local.description: A local or state registration number of the vessel.

/vessels/*/registrations/local/RegExp.description: This regex pattern is used for validating the identifier for the registration

/vessels/*/registrations/other.description: Other registration or permits for the vessel.

/vessels/*/registrations/other/RegExp.description: This regex pattern is used for validating the identifier for the registration

/vessels/*/communication.description: Communication data including Radio, Telephone, E-Mail, etc.

/vessels/*/communication/emailHf.description: Email address to be used for HF email (Winmail, Airmail, Sailmail)

/vessels/*/communication/skipperName.description: Full name of the skipper of the vessel.

/vessels/*/communication/crewNames.description: Array with the names of the crew

/vessels/*/environment.description: Environmental data measured locally including Depth, Wind, Temp, etc.

/vessels/*/environment/outside.description: Environmental conditions outside of the vessel's hull

/vessels/*/environment/outside/apparentW.description: Current outside apparent wind chill temperature

/vessels/*/environment/outside/theoretic.description: Current outside theoretical wind chill temperature

/vessels/*/environment/inside.description: Environmental conditions inside the vessel's hull

/vessels/*/environment/water.description: Environmental conditions of the water that the vessel is sailing in

/vessels/*/environment/depth/transducerT.description: Depth from the transducer to the bottom of the keel

/vessels/*/environment/depth/surfaceToTr.description: Depth transducer is below the water surface

/vessels/*/environment/current.description: Direction and strength of current affecting the vessel

/vessels/*/environment/current/drift.description: The speed component of the water current vector

/vessels/*/environment/current/setTrue.description: The direction component of the water current vector referenced to true (geographic) north

/vessels/*/environment/current/setMagnet.description: The direction component of the water current vector referenced to magnetic north

/vessels/*/environment/tide/heightHigh.description: Next high tide height  relative to lowest astronomical tide (LAT/Chart Datum)

/vessels/*/environment/tide/heightNow.description: The current tide height  relative to lowest astronomical tide (LAT/Chart Datum)

/vessels/*/environment/tide/heightLow.description: The next low tide height relative to lowest astronomical tide (LAT/Chart Datum)

/vessels/*/environment/tide/timeLow.description: Time of the next low tide in UTC

/vessels/*/environment/tide/timeHigh.description: Time of next high tide in UTC

/vessels/*/environment/heave.description: Vertical movement of the vessel due to waves

/vessels/*/environment/wind/angleApparen.description: Apparent wind angle, negative to port

/vessels/*/environment/wind/angleTrueGro.description: True wind angle based on speed over ground, negative to port

/vessels/*/environment/wind/angleTrueWat.description: True wind angle based on speed through water, negative to port

/vessels/*/environment/wind/directionCha.description: The angle the wind needs to shift to raise an alarm

/vessels/*/environment/wind/directionTru.description: The wind direction relative to true north

/vessels/*/environment/wind/directionMag.description: The wind direction relative to magnetic north

/vessels/*/environment/wind/speedTrue.description: Wind speed over water (as calculated from speedApparent and vessel's speed through water)

/vessels/*/environment/wind/speedOverGro.description: Wind speed over ground (as calculated from speedApparent and vessel's speed over ground)

/vessels/*/environment/time.description: A time reference for the vessel. All clocks on the vessel dispaying local time should use the timezone offset here. If a timezoneRegion is supplied the timezone must also be supplied. If timezoneRegion is supplied that should be displayed by UIs in preference to simply timezone. ie 12:05 (Europe/London) should be displayed in preference to 12:05 (UTC+01:00)

/vessels/*/environment/time/timezoneOffs.description: Onboard timezone offset from UTC in hours and minutes (-)hhmm. +ve means east of Greenwich. For use by UIs

/vessels/*/environment/time/timezoneRegi.description: Onboard timezone offset as listed in the IANA timezone database (tz database)

/vessels/*/environment/mode.description: Mode of the vessel based on the current conditions. Can be combined with navigation.state to control vessel signals eg switch to night mode for instrumentation and lights, or make sound signals for fog.

/vessels/*/navigation.description: Navigation data including Position, Course to next WP information, etc.

/vessels/*/navigation/lights.description: Current state of the vessels navigation lights

/vessels/*/navigation/courseRhumbline/cr.description: The distance from the vessel's present position to the closest point on a line (track) between previousPoint and nextPoint. A negative number indicates that the vessel is currently to the left of this line (and thus must steer right to compensate), a positive number means the vessel is to the right of the line (steer left to compensate).

/vessels/*/navigation/courseRhumbline/be.description: The bearing of a line between previousPoint and nextPoint, relative to true north.
The bearing of a line between previousPoint and nextPoint, relative to magnetic north.

/vessels/*/navigation/courseRhumbline/ac.description: Data required if sailing to an active route, defined in resources.
A reference (URL) to the presently active route, in resources.
The estimated time of arrival at the end of the current route
The time this route was activated

/vessels/*/navigation/courseRhumbline/ne.description: The point on earth the vessel's presently navigating towards
The distance in meters between the vessel's present position and the nextPoint
The bearing of a line between the vessel's current position and nextPoint, relative to true north
The bearing of a line between the vessel's current position and nextPoint, relative to magnetic north
The velocity component of the vessel towards the nextPoint
Time in seconds to reach nextPoint's perpendicular) with current speed & direction
The position of nextPoint in two dimensions

/vessels/*/navigation/courseRhumbline/pr.description: The point on earth the vessel's presently navigating from
The distance in meters between previousPoint and the vessel's present position
The position of lastPoint in two dimensions

/vessels/*/navigation/courseGreatCircle.description: Course information computed with Great Circle

/vessels/*/navigation/courseGreatCircle/.description: The distance from the vessel's present position to the closest point on a line (track) between previousPoint and nextPoint. A negative number indicates that the vessel is currently to the left of this line (and thus must steer right to compensate), a positive number means the vessel is to the right of the line (steer left to compensate).
The bearing of a line between previousPoint and nextPoint, relative to true north.
The bearing of a line between previousPoint and nextPoint, relative to magnetic north.
Data required if sailing to an active route, defined in resources.
A reference (URL) to the presently active route, in resources.
The estimated time of arrival at the end of the current route
The time this route was activated
The point on earth the vessel's presently navigating towards
The distance in meters between the vessel's present position and the nextPoint
The bearing of a line between the vessel's current position and nextPoint, relative to true north
The bearing of a line between the vessel's current position and nextPoint, relative to magnetic north
The velocity component of the vessel towards the nextPoint
Time in seconds to reach nextPoint's perpendicular) with current speed & direction
The position of nextPoint in two dimensions
[missing]
[missing]
The point on earth the vessel's presently navigating from
The distance in meters between previousPoint and the vessel's present position
The position of lastPoint in two dimensions
[missing]
[missing]

/vessels/*/navigation/racing.description: Specific navigational data related to yacht racing.

/vessels/*/navigation/racing/distanceSta.description: The current distance to the start line

/vessels/*/navigation/racing/timePortDow.description: Time to arrive at the start line on port, turning downwind

/vessels/*/navigation/racing/timePortUp.description: Time to arrive at the start line on port, turning upwind

/vessels/*/navigation/racing/timeStbdDow.description: Time to arrive at the start line on starboard, turning downwind

/vessels/*/navigation/racing/timeStbdUp.description: Time to arrive at the start line on starboard, turning upwind

/vessels/*/navigation/racing/distanceLay.description: The current distance to the layline

/vessels/*/navigation/magneticVariation.description: The magnetic variation (declination) at the current position

/vessels/*/navigation/magneticVariationA.description: Seconds since the 1st Jan 1970 that the variation calculation was made

/vessels/*/navigation/destination.description: The intended destination of this trip

/vessels/*/navigation/destination/common.description: Common name of the Destination, eg 'Fiji', also used in ais messages

/vessels/*/navigation/destination/eta.description: Expected time of arrival at destination waypoint

/vessels/*/navigation/gnss/geoidalSepara.description: Difference between WGS84 earth ellipsoid and mean sea level

/vessels/*/navigation/headingMagnetic.description: Current magnetic heading of the vessel

/vessels/*/navigation/headingTrue.description: The current true heading of the vessel

/vessels/*/navigation/position.description: The position of the vessel in 2 or 3 dimensions (WGS84 datum)

/vessels/*/navigation/attitude.description: Vessel attitude: roll, pitch and yaw

/vessels/*/navigation/attitude/roll.description: Vessel roll, +ve is list to starboard

/vessels/*/navigation/attitude/yaw.description: Yaw, +ve is heading change to starboard

/vessels/*/navigation/maneuver.description: Special maneuver such as regional passing arrangement. (from ais)

/vessels/*/navigation/rateOfTurn.description: Rate of turn (+ve is change to starboard). If the value is AIS RIGHT or LEFT, set to +-0.0206 rads and add warning in notifications

/vessels/*/navigation/speedOverGround.description: Vessel speed over ground. If converting from AIS 'HIGH' value, set to 102.2 (Ais max value) and add warning in notifications

/vessels/*/navigation/leewayAngle.description: Leeway Angle derived from the longitudinal and transverse speeds through the water

/vessels/*/navigation/trip/log.description: Total distance traveled on this trip / since trip reset

/vessels/*/navigation/state.description: Current navigational state of the vessel

/vessels/*/navigation/anchor.description: The anchor data, for anchor watch etc

/vessels/*/navigation/anchor/maxRadius.description: Radius of anchor alarm boundary. The distance from anchor to the center of the boat

/vessels/*/navigation/anchor/position.description: The actual anchor position of the vessel in 3 dimensions, probably an estimate at best

/vessels/*/navigation/datetime.description: Time and Date from the GNSS Positioning System

/vessels/*/navigation/datetime/gnssTimeS.description: Source of GNSS Date and Time

/vessels/*/propulsion.description: Engine data, each engine identified by a unique name i.e. Port_Engine

/vessels/*/propulsion/RegExp.description: This regex pattern is used for validation of the identifier for the propulsion unit

/vessels/*/propulsion/RegExp/label.description: Human readable label for the propulsion unit

/vessels/*/propulsion/RegExp/state.description: The current state of the engine

/vessels/*/propulsion/RegExp/runTime.description: Total running time for engine (Engine Hours in seconds)

/vessels/*/propulsion/RegExp/transmissio.description: The transmission (gear box) of the named engine
Currently selected gear the engine is in i.e. Forward, Reverse, etc.
Gear ratio, engine rotations per propeller shaft rotation

/vessels/*/propulsion/RegExp/drive/type.description: The type of drive the boat has i.e Outboard, shaft, jet, etc.

/vessels/*/propulsion/RegExp/drive/thrus.description: Current thrust angle for steerable drives, +ve is thrust to Starboard

/vessels/*/propulsion/RegExp/drive/prope.description: Data about the drive's propeller (pitch and slip)

/vessels/*/propulsion/RegExp/fuel.description: Data about the engine's Fuel Supply

/vessels/*/propulsion/RegExp/fuel/used.description: Used fuel since last reset. Resetting is at user discretion

/vessels/*/electrical.description: Electrical data, each electrical device indentified by a unique name i.e. Battery_1

/vessels/*/electrical/batteries/RegExp.description: Batteries, one or many, within the vessel

/vessels/*/electrical/batteries/RegExp/n.description: Unique ID of device (houseBattery, alternator, Generator, solar1, inverter, charger, combiner, etc.)

/vessels/*/electrical/batteries/RegExp/l.description: Installed location of device on vessel

/vessels/*/electrical/batteries/RegExp/a.description: Name of BUS device is associated with

/vessels/*/electrical/batteries/RegExp/v.description: Voltage measured at or as close as possible to the device

/vessels/*/electrical/batteries/RegExp/c.description: Current flowing out (+ve) or in (-ve) to the device

/vessels/*/electrical/batteries/RegExp/t.description: Temperature measured within or on the device
Upper fault temperature limit - device may disable/disconnect
Lower fault temperature limit - device may disable/disconnect
Operational minimum temperature limit for battery discharge
Operational maximum temperature limit for battery discharge
Operational minimum temperature limit for battery recharging
Operational maximum temperature limit for battery recharging

/vessels/*/electrical/batteries/RegExp/c.description: Type of battery FLA, LiFePO4, etc.
The capacity of battery as specified by the manufacturer
The measured capacity of battery. This may change over time and will likely deviate from the nominal capacity.
Minimum capacity to be left in the battery while discharging
Cumulative discharge since battery was last full
Time to discharge to discharge limit at current rate

/vessels/*/electrical/batteries/RegExp/l.description: Cumulative charge discharged from battery over operational lifetime of battery
Cumulative charge recharged into battery over operational lifetime of battery

/vessels/*/electrical/inverters.description: Data about the Inverter that has both DC and AC qualities

/vessels/*/electrical/inverters/RegExp.description: DC to AC inverter, one or many, within the vessel

/vessels/*/electrical/inverters/RegExp/n.description: Unique ID of device (houseBattery, alternator, Generator, solar1, inverter, charger, combiner, etc.)

/vessels/*/electrical/inverters/RegExp/l.description: Installed location of device on vessel

/vessels/*/electrical/inverters/RegExp/d.description: Name of BUS device is associated with
Voltage measured at or as close as possible to the device
Current flowing out (+ve) or in (-ve) to the device
Temperature measured within or on the device
Upper fault temperature limit - device may disable/disconnect
Lower fault temperature limit - device may disable/disconnect

/vessels/*/electrical/inverters/RegExp/a.description: Name of BUS device is associated with
RMS voltage measured between phase and neutral

/vessels/*/electrical/chargers.description: Data about AC sourced battery charger

/vessels/*/electrical/chargers/RegExp/na.description: Unique ID of device (houseBattery, alternator, Generator, solar1, inverter, charger, combiner, etc.)

/vessels/*/electrical/chargers/RegExp/lo.description: Installed location of device on vessel

/vessels/*/electrical/chargers/RegExp/as.description: Name of BUS device is associated with

/vessels/*/electrical/chargers/RegExp/vo.description: Voltage measured at or as close as possible to the device

/vessels/*/electrical/chargers/RegExp/cu.description: Current flowing out (+ve) or in (-ve) to the device

/vessels/*/electrical/chargers/RegExp/te.description: Temperature measured within or on the device
Upper fault temperature limit - device may disable/disconnect
Lower fault temperature limit - device may disable/disconnect

/vessels/*/electrical/chargers/RegExp/ch.description: Algorithm being used by the charger
How is charging source configured?  Standalone, or in sync with another charger?
Charging mode i.e. float, overcharge, etc.

/vessels/*/electrical/alternators.description: Data about an Alternator charging device

/vessels/*/electrical/alternators/RegExp.description: Mechanically driven alternator, includes dynamos
Unique ID of device (houseBattery, alternator, Generator, solar1, inverter, charger, combiner, etc.)
Installed location of device on vessel
Date device was installed

/vessels/*/electrical/solar/RegExp/name.description: Unique ID of device (houseBattery, alternator, Generator, solar1, inverter, charger, combiner, etc.)

/vessels/*/electrical/solar/RegExp/locat.description: Installed location of device on vessel

/vessels/*/electrical/solar/RegExp/assoc.description: Name of BUS device is associated with

/vessels/*/electrical/solar/RegExp/volta.description: Voltage measured at or as close as possible to the device

/vessels/*/electrical/solar/RegExp/curre.description: Current flowing out (+ve) or in (-ve) to the device

/vessels/*/electrical/solar/RegExp/tempe.description: Temperature measured within or on the device
Upper fault temperature limit - device may disable/disconnect
Lower fault temperature limit - device may disable/disconnect

How is charging source configured?  Standalone, or in sync with another charger?
Charging mode i.e. float, overcharge, etc.

/vessels/*/electrical/solar/RegExp/contr.description: The current state of the engine

/vessels/*/electrical/solar/RegExp/panel.description: Voltage being supplied from Solar Panels to controller
Amperage being supplied from Solar Panels to controller

/vessels/*/electrical/solar/RegExp/load.description: State of load port on controller (if applicable)

/vessels/*/electrical/solar/RegExp/loadC.description: Amperage being supplied to load directly connected to controller

/vessels/*/electrical/ac/RegExp.description: AC Bus, one or many, within the vessel

/vessels/*/electrical/ac/RegExp/name.description: Unique ID of device (houseBattery, alternator, Generator, solar1, inverter, charger, combiner, etc.)

/vessels/*/electrical/ac/RegExp/location.description: Installed location of device on vessel

/vessels/*/electrical/ac/RegExp/phase.description: Single or A,B or C in 3 Phase systems

/vessels/*/electrical/ac/RegExp/phase/(s.description: Name of BUS device is associated with
RMS voltage measured between phase and neutral

/vessels/*/notifications.description: Notifications currently raised. Major categories have well-defined names, but the tree can be extended by any hierarchical structure

/vessels/*/notifications/mob/method.description: Method to use to raise notifications

/vessels/*/notifications/fire/method.description: Method to use to raise notifications

/vessels/*/notifications/sinking/method.description: Method to use to raise notifications

/vessels/*/notifications/flooding/method.description: Method to use to raise notifications

/vessels/*/notifications/collision.description: In collision with another vessel or object

/vessels/*/notifications/collision/metho.description: Method to use to raise notifications

/vessels/*/notifications/grounding/metho.description: Method to use to raise notifications

/vessels/*/notifications/listing/method.description: Method to use to raise notifications

/vessels/*/notifications/adrift/method.description: Method to use to raise notifications

/vessels/*/notifications/piracy.description: Under attack or danger from pirates

/vessels/*/notifications/piracy/method.description: Method to use to raise notifications

/vessels/*/notifications/abandon/method.description: Method to use to raise notifications

/vessels/*/notifications/RegExp.description: This regex pattern is used for validation of the path of the alarm

/vessels/*/steering.description: Vessel steering data for steering controls (not Autopilot 'Nav Data')

/vessels/*/steering/rudderAngle.description: Current rudder angle, +ve is rudder to Starboard

/vessels/*/steering/rudderAngleTarget.description: The angle the rudder should move to, +ve is rudder to Starboard

/vessels/*/steering/autopilot/target/win.description: Target angle to steer, relative to Apparent wind +port -starboard

/vessels/*/steering/autopilot/target/hea.description: Target heading for autopilot, relative to North
Target heading for autopilot, relative to Magnetic North

/vessels/*/steering/autopilot/deadZone.description: Dead zone to ignore for rudder corrections

/vessels/*/steering/autopilot/backlash.description: Slack in the rudder drive mechanism

/vessels/*/steering/autopilot/gain.description: Auto-pilot gain, higher number equals more rudder movement for a given turn

/vessels/*/steering/autopilot/maxDriveCu.description: Maximum current to use to drive servo

/vessels/*/steering/autopilot/portLock.description: Position of servo on port lock

/vessels/*/steering/autopilot/starboardL.description: Position of servo on starboard lock

/vessels/*/tanks.description: Tank data, each tank indentified by a unique name i.e. FreshWater_2

/vessels/*/tanks/freshWater/RegExp.description: Tank, one or many, within the vessel

/vessels/*/tanks/freshWater/RegExp/name.description: The name of the tank. Useful if multiple tanks of a certain type are on board

/vessels/*/tanks/freshWater/RegExp/press.description: Pressure of contents in tank, especially LPG/gas

/vessels/*/tanks/freshWater/RegExp/tempe.description: Temperature of tank, especially cryogenic or LPG/gas

/vessels/*/tanks/freshWater/RegExp/visco.description: Viscosity of the fluid, if applicable

/vessels/*/tanks/freshWater/RegExp/extin.description: The preferred extinguishant to douse a fire in this tank

/vessels/*/tanks/wasteWater/RegExp.description: Tank, one or many, within the vessel

/vessels/*/tanks/wasteWater/RegExp/name.description: The name of the tank. Useful if multiple tanks of a certain type are on board

/vessels/*/tanks/wasteWater/RegExp/press.description: Pressure of contents in tank, especially LPG/gas

/vessels/*/tanks/wasteWater/RegExp/tempe.description: Temperature of tank, especially cryogenic or LPG/gas

/vessels/*/tanks/wasteWater/RegExp/visco.description: Viscosity of the fluid, if applicable

/vessels/*/tanks/wasteWater/RegExp/extin.description: The preferred extinguishant to douse a fire in this tank

/vessels/*/tanks/blackWater/RegExp/name.description: The name of the tank. Useful if multiple tanks of a certain type are on board

/vessels/*/tanks/blackWater/RegExp/press.description: Pressure of contents in tank, especially LPG/gas

/vessels/*/tanks/blackWater/RegExp/tempe.description: Temperature of tank, especially cryogenic or LPG/gas

/vessels/*/tanks/blackWater/RegExp/visco.description: Viscosity of the fluid, if applicable

/vessels/*/tanks/blackWater/RegExp/extin.description: The preferred extinguishant to douse a fire in this tank

/vessels/*/tanks/fuel/RegExp.description: Tank, one or many, within the vessel

/vessels/*/tanks/fuel/RegExp/name.description: The name of the tank. Useful if multiple tanks of a certain type are on board

/vessels/*/tanks/fuel/RegExp/pressure.description: Pressure of contents in tank, especially LPG/gas

/vessels/*/tanks/fuel/RegExp/temperature.description: Temperature of tank, especially cryogenic or LPG/gas

/vessels/*/tanks/fuel/RegExp/viscosity.description: Viscosity of the fluid, if applicable

/vessels/*/tanks/fuel/RegExp/extinguisha.description: The preferred extinguishant to douse a fire in this tank

/vessels/*/tanks/lubrication/RegExp.description: Tank, one or many, within the vessel

/vessels/*/tanks/lubrication/RegExp/name.description: The name of the tank. Useful if multiple tanks of a certain type are on board

/vessels/*/tanks/lubrication/RegExp/pres.description: Pressure of contents in tank, especially LPG/gas

/vessels/*/tanks/lubrication/RegExp/temp.description: Temperature of tank, especially cryogenic or LPG/gas

/vessels/*/tanks/lubrication/RegExp/visc.description: Viscosity of the fluid, if applicable

/vessels/*/tanks/lubrication/RegExp/exti.description: The preferred extinguishant to douse a fire in this tank

/vessels/*/tanks/liveWell/RegExp.description: Tank, one or many, within the vessel

/vessels/*/tanks/liveWell/RegExp/name.description: The name of the tank. Useful if multiple tanks of a certain type are on board

/vessels/*/tanks/liveWell/RegExp/pressur.description: Pressure of contents in tank, especially LPG/gas

/vessels/*/tanks/liveWell/RegExp/tempera.description: Temperature of tank, especially cryogenic or LPG/gas

/vessels/*/tanks/liveWell/RegExp/viscosi.description: Viscosity of the fluid, if applicable

/vessels/*/tanks/liveWell/RegExp/extingu.description: The preferred extinguishant to douse a fire in this tank

/vessels/*/tanks/gas/RegExp.description: Tank, one or many, within the vessel

/vessels/*/tanks/gas/RegExp/name.description: The name of the tank. Useful if multiple tanks of a certain type are on board

/vessels/*/tanks/gas/RegExp/pressure.description: Pressure of contents in tank, especially LPG/gas

/vessels/*/tanks/gas/RegExp/temperature.description: Temperature of tank, especially cryogenic or LPG/gas

/vessels/*/tanks/gas/RegExp/viscosity.description: Viscosity of the fluid, if applicable

/vessels/*/tanks/gas/RegExp/extinguishan.description: The preferred extinguishant to douse a fire in this tank

/vessels/*/tanks/ballast/RegExp.description: Tank, one or many, within the vessel

/vessels/*/tanks/ballast/RegExp/name.description: The name of the tank. Useful if multiple tanks of a certain type are on board

/vessels/*/tanks/ballast/RegExp/pressure.description: Pressure of contents in tank, especially LPG/gas

/vessels/*/tanks/ballast/RegExp/temperat.description: Temperature of tank, especially cryogenic or LPG/gas

/vessels/*/tanks/ballast/RegExp/viscosit.description: Viscosity of the fluid, if applicable

/vessels/*/tanks/ballast/RegExp/extingui.description: The preferred extinguishant to douse a fire in this tank

/vessels/*/design/aisShipType.description: The ais ship type and cargo, see http://www.bosunsmate.org/ais/message5.php

/vessels/*/design/draft/minimum.description: The minimum draft of the vessel

/vessels/*/design/draft/maximum.description: The maximum draft of the vessel

/vessels/*/design/draft/canoe.description: The draft of the vessel without protrusions such as keel, centerboard, rudder

/vessels/*/design/length.description: The various lengths of the vessel

/vessels/*/design/keel/angle.description: A number indicating at which angle the keel currently is (in case of a canting keel), negative to port.

/vessels/*/design/keel/lift.description: In the case of a lifting keel, centreboard or daggerboard, the part of the keel which is extended. 0 is 'all the way up' and 1 is 'all the way down'. 0.8 would be 80% down.

/vessels/*/design/rigging/masts.description: The number of masts on the vessel.

/vessels/*/sails/inventory.description: An object containing a description of each sail available to the vessel crew

/vessels/*/sails/inventory/RegExp/name.description: An unique identifier by which the crew identifies a sail

/vessels/*/sails/inventory/RegExp/materi.description: The material the sail is made from (optional)

/vessels/*/sails/inventory/RegExp/active.description: Indicates wether this sail is currently in use or not

/vessels/*/sails/inventory/RegExp/area.description: The total area of this sail in square meters

/vessels/*/sails/inventory/RegExp/minimu.description: The minimum wind speed this sail can be used with

/vessels/*/sails/inventory/RegExp/maximu.description: The maximum wind speed this sail can be used with

/vessels/*/sails/area.description: An object containing information about the vessels' sails.

/vessels/*/sails/area/total.description: The total area of all sails on the vessel

/vessels/*/sails/area/active.description: The total area of the sails currently in use on the vessel

/vessels/*/sensors/RegExp.description: This regex pattern is used for validation UUID identifier for the sensor

/vessels/*/sensors/RegExp/name.description: The common name of the sensor

/vessels/*/sensors/RegExp/sensorType.description: The datamodel definition of the sensor data. FIXME - need to create a definitions lib of sensor datamodel types

/vessels/*/sensors/RegExp/sensorData.description: The data of the sensor data. FIXME - need to ref the definitions of sensor types

/vessels/*/sensors/RegExp/fromBow.description: The distance from the bow to the sensor location

/vessels/*/sensors/RegExp/fromCenter.description: The distance from the centerline to the sensor location, -ve to starboard, +ve to port

/vessels/*/performance.description: Performance Sailing data including VMG, Polar Speed, tack angle, etc.

/vessels/*/performance/polarSpeed.description: The current polar speed based on current polar diagram, WindSpeedTrue and angleTrueWater.

/vessels/*/performance/polarSpeedRatio.description: The ratio of current speed through water to the polar speed.

/vessels/*/performance/velocityMadeGood.description: The current velocity made good derived from the speed through water and appearant wind angle. A positive value is heading to upwind, negative to downwind.

/vessels/*/performance/velocityMadeGoodT.description: The current velocity made good to the next waypoint derived from the speedOverGround, courseOverGround.

/vessels/*/performance/beatAngle.description: The true wind beat angle for the best velocity made good based on current current polar diagram and WindSpeedTrue.

/vessels/*/performance/beatAngleVelocity.description: The velocity made good for the beat angle.

/vessels/*/performance/beatAngleTargetSp.description: The target speed for the beat angle.

/vessels/*/performance/gybeAngle.description: The true wind gybe angle for the best velocity made good downwind based on current polar diagram and WindSpeedTrue.

/vessels/*/performance/gybeAngleVelocity.description: The velocity made good for the gybe angle

/vessels/*/performance/gybeAngleTargetSp.description: The target speed for the gybe angle.

/vessels/*/performance/targetAngle.description: The true wind gybe or beat angle for the best velocity made good downwind or upwind based on current polar diagram and WindSpeedTrue.

/vessels/*/performance/targetSpeed.description: The target speed for the beat angle or gybe angle, which ever is applicable.

/aircraft.description: A wrapper object for aircraft, primarily intended for SAR aircraft in relation to marine search and rescue. For clarity about seaplanes etc, if it CAN fly, its an aircraft.

/aircraft/*.description: This regex pattern is used for validation of an MMSI or Signal K UUID identifier for the aircraft. Examples: urn:mrn:imo:mmsi:111099999 urn:mrn:signalk:uuid:c0d79334-4e25-4245-8892-54e8ccc8021d

/aircraft/*/url.description: URL based identity of the aircraft, if available.

/aircraft/*/mmsi.description: MMSI number of the aircraft, if available.

/aircraft/*/uuid.description: A unique Signal K flavoured maritime resource identifier, assigned by the server.

/aircraft/*/flag.description: The country of aircraft registration, or flag state of the aircraft

/aircraft/*/base.description: The home base of the aircraft

/aircraft/*/registrations.description: The various registrations of the aircraft.

/aircraft/*/registrations/imo.description: The IMO number of the aircraft.

/aircraft/*/registrations/national.description: The national registration number of the aircraft.

/aircraft/*/registrations/national/RegEx.description: This regex pattern is used for validating the identifier for the registration

/aircraft/*/registrations/other.description: Other registration or permits for the aircraft.

/aircraft/*/registrations/other/RegExp.description: This regex pattern is used for validating the identifier for the registration

/aircraft/*/communication.description: Communication data including Radio, Telephone, E-Mail, etc.

/aircraft/*/communication/emailHf.description: Email address to be used for HF email (Winmail, Airmail, Sailmail)

/aircraft/*/communication/skipperName.description: Full name of the skipper of the vessel.

/aircraft/*/communication/crewNames.description: Array with the names of the crew

/aircraft/*/environment.description: Environmental data measured locally including Depth, Wind, Temp, etc.

/aircraft/*/environment/outside.description: Environmental conditions outside of the vessel's hull

/aircraft/*/environment/outside/apparent.description: Current outside apparent wind chill temperature

/aircraft/*/environment/outside/theoreti.description: Current outside theoretical wind chill temperature

/aircraft/*/environment/inside.description: Environmental conditions inside the vessel's hull

/aircraft/*/environment/water.description: Environmental conditions of the water that the vessel is sailing in

/aircraft/*/environment/depth/transducer.description: Depth from the transducer to the bottom of the keel

/aircraft/*/environment/depth/surfaceToT.description: Depth transducer is below the water surface

/aircraft/*/environment/current.description: Direction and strength of current affecting the vessel

/aircraft/*/environment/current/drift.description: The speed component of the water current vector

/aircraft/*/environment/current/setTrue.description: The direction component of the water current vector referenced to true (geographic) north

/aircraft/*/environment/current/setMagne.description: The direction component of the water current vector referenced to magnetic north

/aircraft/*/environment/tide/heightHigh.description: Next high tide height  relative to lowest astronomical tide (LAT/Chart Datum)

/aircraft/*/environment/tide/heightNow.description: The current tide height  relative to lowest astronomical tide (LAT/Chart Datum)

/aircraft/*/environment/tide/heightLow.description: The next low tide height relative to lowest astronomical tide (LAT/Chart Datum)

/aircraft/*/environment/tide/timeLow.description: Time of the next low tide in UTC

/aircraft/*/environment/tide/timeHigh.description: Time of next high tide in UTC

/aircraft/*/environment/heave.description: Vertical movement of the vessel due to waves

/aircraft/*/environment/wind/angleAppare.description: Apparent wind angle, negative to port

/aircraft/*/environment/wind/angleTrueGr.description: True wind angle based on speed over ground, negative to port

/aircraft/*/environment/wind/angleTrueWa.description: True wind angle based on speed through water, negative to port

/aircraft/*/environment/wind/directionCh.description: The angle the wind needs to shift to raise an alarm

/aircraft/*/environment/wind/directionTr.description: The wind direction relative to true north

/aircraft/*/environment/wind/directionMa.description: The wind direction relative to magnetic north

/aircraft/*/environment/wind/speedTrue.description: Wind speed over water (as calculated from speedApparent and vessel's speed through water)

/aircraft/*/environment/wind/speedOverGr.description: Wind speed over ground (as calculated from speedApparent and vessel's speed over ground)

/aircraft/*/environment/time.description: A time reference for the vessel. All clocks on the vessel dispaying local time should use the timezone offset here. If a timezoneRegion is supplied the timezone must also be supplied. If timezoneRegion is supplied that should be displayed by UIs in preference to simply timezone. ie 12:05 (Europe/London) should be displayed in preference to 12:05 (UTC+01:00)

/aircraft/*/environment/time/timezoneOff.description: Onboard timezone offset from UTC in hours and minutes (-)hhmm. +ve means east of Greenwich. For use by UIs

/aircraft/*/environment/time/timezoneReg.description: Onboard timezone offset as listed in the IANA timezone database (tz database)

/aircraft/*/environment/mode.description: Mode of the vessel based on the current conditions. Can be combined with navigation.state to control vessel signals eg switch to night mode for instrumentation and lights, or make sound signals for fog.

/aircraft/*/navigation.description: Navigation data including Position, Course to next WP information, etc.

/aircraft/*/navigation/lights.description: Current state of the vessels navigation lights

/aircraft/*/navigation/courseRhumbline/c.description: The distance from the vessel's present position to the closest point on a line (track) between previousPoint and nextPoint. A negative number indicates that the vessel is currently to the left of this line (and thus must steer right to compensate), a positive number means the vessel is to the right of the line (steer left to compensate).

/aircraft/*/navigation/courseRhumbline/b.description: The bearing of a line between previousPoint and nextPoint, relative to true north.
The bearing of a line between previousPoint and nextPoint, relative to magnetic north.

/aircraft/*/navigation/courseRhumbline/a.description: Data required if sailing to an active route, defined in resources.
A reference (URL) to the presently active route, in resources.
The estimated time of arrival at the end of the current route
The time this route was activated

/aircraft/*/navigation/courseRhumbline/n.description: The point on earth the vessel's presently navigating towards
The distance in meters between the vessel's present position and the nextPoint
The bearing of a line between the vessel's current position and nextPoint, relative to true north
The bearing of a line between the vessel's current position and nextPoint, relative to magnetic north
The velocity component of the vessel towards the nextPoint
Time in seconds to reach nextPoint's perpendicular) with current speed & direction
The position of nextPoint in two dimensions

/aircraft/*/navigation/courseRhumbline/p.description: The point on earth the vessel's presently navigating from
The distance in meters between previousPoint and the vessel's present position
The position of lastPoint in two dimensions

/aircraft/*/navigation/courseGreatCircle.description: Course information computed with Great Circle

The distance from the vessel's present position to the closest point on a line (track) between previousPoint and nextPoint. A negative number indicates that the vessel is currently to the left of this line (and thus must steer right to compensate), a positive number means the vessel is to the right of the line (steer left to compensate).
The bearing of a line between previousPoint and nextPoint, relative to true north.
The bearing of a line between previousPoint and nextPoint, relative to magnetic north.
Data required if sailing to an active route, defined in resources.
A reference (URL) to the presently active route, in resources.
The estimated time of arrival at the end of the current route
The time this route was activated
The point on earth the vessel's presently navigating towards
The distance in meters between the vessel's present position and the nextPoint
The bearing of a line between the vessel's current position and nextPoint, relative to true north
The bearing of a line between the vessel's current position and nextPoint, relative to magnetic north
The velocity component of the vessel towards the nextPoint
Time in seconds to reach nextPoint's perpendicular) with current speed & direction
The position of nextPoint in two dimensions

[missing]

/aircraft/*/navigation/racing.description: Specific navigational data related to yacht racing.

/aircraft/*/navigation/racing/distanceSt.description: The current distance to the start line

/aircraft/*/navigation/racing/timePortDo.description: Time to arrive at the start line on port, turning downwind

/aircraft/*/navigation/racing/timePortUp.description: Time to arrive at the start line on port, turning upwind

/aircraft/*/navigation/racing/timeStbdDo.description: Time to arrive at the start line on starboard, turning downwind

/aircraft/*/navigation/racing/timeStbdUp.description: Time to arrive at the start line on starboard, turning upwind

/aircraft/*/navigation/racing/distanceLa.description: The current distance to the layline

/aircraft/*/navigation/magneticVariation.description: The magnetic variation (declination) at the current position
Seconds since the 1st Jan 1970 that the variation calculation was made

/aircraft/*/navigation/destination.description: The intended destination of this trip

/aircraft/*/navigation/destination/commo.description: Common name of the Destination, eg 'Fiji', also used in ais messages

/aircraft/*/navigation/destination/eta.description: Expected time of arrival at destination waypoint

/aircraft/*/navigation/gnss/geoidalSepar.description: Difference between WGS84 earth ellipsoid and mean sea level

/aircraft/*/navigation/headingMagnetic.description: Current magnetic heading of the vessel

/aircraft/*/navigation/headingTrue.description: The current true heading of the vessel

/aircraft/*/navigation/position.description: The position of the vessel in 2 or 3 dimensions (WGS84 datum)

/aircraft/*/navigation/attitude.description: Vessel attitude: roll, pitch and yaw

/aircraft/*/navigation/attitude/roll.description: Vessel roll, +ve is list to starboard

/aircraft/*/navigation/attitude/yaw.description: Yaw, +ve is heading change to starboard

/aircraft/*/navigation/maneuver.description: Special maneuver such as regional passing arrangement. (from ais)

/aircraft/*/navigation/rateOfTurn.description: Rate of turn (+ve is change to starboard). If the value is AIS RIGHT or LEFT, set to +-0.0206 rads and add warning in notifications

/aircraft/*/navigation/speedOverGround.description: Vessel speed over ground. If converting from AIS 'HIGH' value, set to 102.2 (Ais max value) and add warning in notifications

/aircraft/*/navigation/leewayAngle.description: Leeway Angle derived from the longitudinal and transverse speeds through the water

/aircraft/*/navigation/trip/log.description: Total distance traveled on this trip / since trip reset

/aircraft/*/navigation/state.description: Current navigational state of the vessel

/aircraft/*/navigation/anchor.description: The anchor data, for anchor watch etc

/aircraft/*/navigation/anchor/maxRadius.description: Radius of anchor alarm boundary. The distance from anchor to the center of the boat

/aircraft/*/navigation/anchor/position.description: The actual anchor position of the vessel in 3 dimensions, probably an estimate at best

/aircraft/*/navigation/datetime.description: Time and Date from the GNSS Positioning System

/aircraft/*/navigation/datetime/gnssTime.description: Source of GNSS Date and Time

/aircraft/*/notifications.description: Notifications currently raised. Major categories have well-defined names, but the tree can be extended by any hierarchical structure

/aircraft/*/notifications/RegExp.description: This regex pattern is used for validation of the path of the alarm

/aircraft/*/design/aisShipType.description: The ais ship type and cargo, see http://www.bosunsmate.org/ais/message5.php

/aircraft/*/design/draft/minimum.description: The minimum draft of the vessel

/aircraft/*/design/draft/maximum.description: The maximum draft of the vessel

/aircraft/*/design/draft/canoe.description: The draft of the vessel without protrusions such as keel, centerboard, rudder

/aircraft/*/design/length.description: The various lengths of the vessel

/aircraft/*/design/keel/angle.description: A number indicating at which angle the keel currently is (in case of a canting keel), negative to port.

/aircraft/*/design/keel/lift.description: In the case of a lifting keel, centreboard or daggerboard, the part of the keel which is extended. 0 is 'all the way up' and 1 is 'all the way down'. 0.8 would be 80% down.

/aircraft/*/design/rigging/masts.description: The number of masts on the vessel.

/aircraft/*/sensors/RegExp.description: This regex pattern is used for validation UUID identifier for the sensor

/aircraft/*/sensors/RegExp/name.description: The common name of the sensor

/aircraft/*/sensors/RegExp/sensorType.description: The datamodel definition of the sensor data. FIXME - need to create a definitions lib of sensor datamodel types

/aircraft/*/sensors/RegExp/sensorData.description: The data of the sensor data. FIXME - need to ref the definitions of sensor types

/aircraft/*/sensors/RegExp/fromBow.description: The distance from the bow to the sensor location

/aircraft/*/sensors/RegExp/fromCenter.description: The distance from the centerline to the sensor location, -ve to starboard, +ve to port

/aton.description: A wrapper object for Aids to Navigation (aton's)

/aton/*.description: This regex pattern is used for validation of an MMSI or Signal K UUID identifier for the aid to navigation. Examples: urn:mrn:imo:mmsi:991099999 urn:mrn:signalk:uuid:c0d79334-4e25-4245-8892-54e8ccc8021d

/aton/*/url.description: URL based identity of the aid to navigation, if available.

/aton/*/mmsi.description: MMSI number of the aid to navigation, if available.

/aton/*/uuid.description: A unique Signal K flavoured maritime resource identifier, assigned by the server.

enum: 0 Default, Type of AtoN not specified
3 Fixed structures off-shore, such as oil platforms, wind farms.

/aton/*/communication.description: Communication data including Radio, Telephone, E-Mail, etc.

/aton/*/communication/emailHf.description: Email address to be used for HF email (Winmail, Airmail, Sailmail)

/aton/*/communication/skipperName.description: Full name of the skipper of the vessel.

/aton/*/communication/crewNames.description: Array with the names of the crew

/aton/*/environment.description: Environmental data measured locally including Depth, Wind, Temp, etc.

/aton/*/environment/outside.description: Environmental conditions outside of the vessel's hull

/aton/*/environment/outside/apparentWind.description: Current outside apparent wind chill temperature

/aton/*/environment/outside/theoreticalW.description: Current outside theoretical wind chill temperature

/aton/*/environment/inside.description: Environmental conditions inside the vessel's hull

/aton/*/environment/water.description: Environmental conditions of the water that the vessel is sailing in

/aton/*/environment/depth/transducerToKe.description: Depth from the transducer to the bottom of the keel

/aton/*/environment/depth/surfaceToTrans.description: Depth transducer is below the water surface

/aton/*/environment/current.description: Direction and strength of current affecting the vessel

/aton/*/environment/current/drift.description: The speed component of the water current vector

/aton/*/environment/current/setTrue.description: The direction component of the water current vector referenced to true (geographic) north

/aton/*/environment/current/setMagnetic.description: The direction component of the water current vector referenced to magnetic north

/aton/*/environment/tide/heightHigh.description: Next high tide height  relative to lowest astronomical tide (LAT/Chart Datum)

/aton/*/environment/tide/heightNow.description: The current tide height  relative to lowest astronomical tide (LAT/Chart Datum)

/aton/*/environment/tide/heightLow.description: The next low tide height relative to lowest astronomical tide (LAT/Chart Datum)

/aton/*/environment/tide/timeLow.description: Time of the next low tide in UTC

/aton/*/environment/tide/timeHigh.description: Time of next high tide in UTC

/aton/*/environment/heave.description: Vertical movement of the vessel due to waves

/aton/*/environment/wind/angleApparent.description: Apparent wind angle, negative to port

/aton/*/environment/wind/angleTrueGround.description: True wind angle based on speed over ground, negative to port

/aton/*/environment/wind/angleTrueWater.description: True wind angle based on speed through water, negative to port

/aton/*/environment/wind/directionChange.description: The angle the wind needs to shift to raise an alarm

/aton/*/environment/wind/directionTrue.description: The wind direction relative to true north

/aton/*/environment/wind/directionMagnet.description: The wind direction relative to magnetic north

/aton/*/environment/wind/speedTrue.description: Wind speed over water (as calculated from speedApparent and vessel's speed through water)

/aton/*/environment/wind/speedOverGround.description: Wind speed over ground (as calculated from speedApparent and vessel's speed over ground)

/aton/*/environment/time.description: A time reference for the vessel. All clocks on the vessel dispaying local time should use the timezone offset here. If a timezoneRegion is supplied the timezone must also be supplied. If timezoneRegion is supplied that should be displayed by UIs in preference to simply timezone. ie 12:05 (Europe/London) should be displayed in preference to 12:05 (UTC+01:00)

/aton/*/environment/time/timezoneOffset.description: Onboard timezone offset from UTC in hours and minutes (-)hhmm. +ve means east of Greenwich. For use by UIs

/aton/*/environment/time/timezoneRegion.description: Onboard timezone offset as listed in the IANA timezone database (tz database)

/aton/*/environment/mode.description: Mode of the vessel based on the current conditions. Can be combined with navigation.state to control vessel signals eg switch to night mode for instrumentation and lights, or make sound signals for fog.

/aton/*/navigation.description: Navigation data including Position, Course to next WP information, etc.

/aton/*/navigation/lights.description: Current state of the vessels navigation lights

/aton/*/navigation/courseRhumbline/cross.description: The distance from the vessel's present position to the closest point on a line (track) between previousPoint and nextPoint. A negative number indicates that the vessel is currently to the left of this line (and thus must steer right to compensate), a positive number means the vessel is to the right of the line (steer left to compensate).

/aton/*/navigation/courseRhumbline/beari.description: The bearing of a line between previousPoint and nextPoint, relative to true north.
The bearing of a line between previousPoint and nextPoint, relative to magnetic north.

/aton/*/navigation/courseRhumbline/activ.description: Data required if sailing to an active route, defined in resources.

The estimated time of arrival at the end of the current route
The time this route was activated

/aton/*/navigation/courseRhumbline/nextP.description: The point on earth the vessel's presently navigating towards

/aton/*/navigation/racing/distanceStartl.description: The current distance to the start line

/aton/*/navigation/racing/timePortDown.description: Time to arrive at the start line on port, turning downwind

/aton/*/sensors/RegExp/fromCenter.description: The distance from the centerline to the sensor location, -ve to starboard, +ve to port

/sar.description: A wrapper object for Search And Rescue (SAR) MMSI's usied in transponders. MOB, EPIRBS etc

/sar/*.description: This regex pattern is used for validation of an MMSI or Signal K UUID identifier for the aid to navigation. Examples: urn:mrn:imo:mmsi:972099999 urn:mrn:signalk:uuid:c0d79334-4e25-4245-8892-54e8ccc8021d

/sar/*/url.description: URL based identity of the aid to navigation, if available.

/sar/*/mmsi.description: MMSI number of the aid to navigation, if available.

/sar/*/uuid.description: A unique Signal K flavoured maritime resource identifier, assigned by the server.

/sar/*/communication.description: Communication data including Radio, Telephone, E-Mail, etc.

/sar/*/communication/emailHf.description: Email address to be used for HF email (Winmail, Airmail, Sailmail)

/sar/*/communication/skipperName.description: Full name of the skipper of the vessel.

/sar/*/communication/crewNames.description: Array with the names of the crew

/sar/*/navigation.description: Navigation data including Position, Course to next WP information, etc.

/sar/*/navigation/lights.description: Current state of the vessels navigation lights

/sar/*/navigation/courseRhumbline/crossT.description: The distance from the vessel's present position to the closest point on a line (track) between previousPoint and nextPoint. A negative number indicates that the vessel is currently to the left of this line (and thus must steer right to compensate), a positive number means the vessel is to the right of the line (steer left to compensate).

/sar/*/navigation/courseRhumbline/bearin.description: The bearing of a line between previousPoint and nextPoint, relative to true north.
The bearing of a line between previousPoint and nextPoint, relative to magnetic north.

/sar/*/navigation/courseRhumbline/active.description: Data required if sailing to an active route, defined in resources.
A reference (URL) to the presently active route, in resources.
The estimated time of arrival at the end of the current route
The time this route was activated

/sar/*/navigation/courseRhumbline/nextPo.description: The point on earth the vessel's presently navigating towards
The distance in meters between the vessel's present position and the nextPoint
The bearing of a line between the vessel's current position and nextPoint, relative to true north
The bearing of a line between the vessel's current position and nextPoint, relative to magnetic north
The velocity component of the vessel towards the nextPoint
Time in seconds to reach nextPoint's perpendicular) with current speed & direction
The position of nextPoint in two dimensions

/sar/*/navigation/courseRhumbline/previo.description: The point on earth the vessel's presently navigating from
The distance in meters between previousPoint and the vessel's present position
The position of lastPoint in two dimensions

/sar/*/navigation/courseGreatCircle.description: Course information computed with Great Circle

/sar/*/navigation/courseGreatCircle/cros.description: The distance from the vessel's present position to the closest point on a line (track) between previousPoint and nextPoint. A negative number indicates that the vessel is currently to the left of this line (and thus must steer right to compensate), a positive number means the vessel is to the right of the line (steer left to compensate).

/sar/*/navigation/courseGreatCircle/bear.description: The bearing of a line between previousPoint and nextPoint, relative to true north.
The bearing of a line between previousPoint and nextPoint, relative to magnetic north.

/sar/*/navigation/courseGreatCircle/acti.description: Data required if sailing to an active route, defined in resources.
A reference (URL) to the presently active route, in resources.
The estimated time of arrival at the end of the current route
The time this route was activated

/sar/*/navigation/courseGreatCircle/next.description: The point on earth the vessel's presently navigating towards
The distance in meters between the vessel's present position and the nextPoint
The bearing of a line between the vessel's current position and nextPoint, relative to true north
The bearing of a line between the vessel's current position and nextPoint, relative to magnetic north
The velocity component of the vessel towards the nextPoint
Time in seconds to reach nextPoint's perpendicular) with current speed & direction
The position of nextPoint in two dimensions

/sar/*/navigation/courseGreatCircle/prev.description: The point on earth the vessel's presently navigating from
The distance in meters between previousPoint and the vessel's present position
The position of lastPoint in two dimensions

/sar/*/navigation/racing.description: Specific navigational data related to yacht racing.

/sar/*/navigation/racing/distanceStartli.description: The current distance to the start line

/sar/*/navigation/racing/timePortDown.description: Time to arrive at the start line on port, turning downwind

/sar/*/navigation/racing/timePortUp.description: Time to arrive at the start line on port, turning upwind

/sar/*/navigation/racing/timeStbdDown.description: Time to arrive at the start line on starboard, turning downwind

/sar/*/navigation/racing/timeStbdUp.description: Time to arrive at the start line on starboard, turning upwind

/sar/*/navigation/racing/distanceLayline.description: The current distance to the layline

/sar/*/navigation/magneticVariation.description: The magnetic variation (declination) at the current position

/sar/*/navigation/magneticVariationAgeOf.description: Seconds since the 1st Jan 1970 that the variation calculation was made

/sar/*/navigation/destination.description: The intended destination of this trip

/sar/*/navigation/destination/commonName.description: Common name of the Destination, eg 'Fiji', also used in ais messages

/sar/*/navigation/destination/eta.description: Expected time of arrival at destination waypoint

/sar/*/navigation/gnss/geoidalSeparation.description: Difference between WGS84 earth ellipsoid and mean sea level

/sar/*/navigation/headingMagnetic.description: Current magnetic heading of the vessel

/sar/*/navigation/headingTrue.description: The current true heading of the vessel

/sar/*/navigation/position.description: The position of the vessel in 2 or 3 dimensions (WGS84 datum)

/sar/*/navigation/attitude.description: Vessel attitude: roll, pitch and yaw

/sar/*/navigation/attitude/roll.description: Vessel roll, +ve is list to starboard

/sar/*/navigation/attitude/yaw.description: Yaw, +ve is heading change to starboard

/sar/*/navigation/maneuver.description: Special maneuver such as regional passing arrangement. (from ais)

/sar/*/navigation/rateOfTurn.description: Rate of turn (+ve is change to starboard). If the value is AIS RIGHT or LEFT, set to +-0.0206 rads and add warning in notifications

/sar/*/navigation/speedOverGround.description: Vessel speed over ground. If converting from AIS 'HIGH' value, set to 102.2 (Ais max value) and add warning in notifications

/sar/*/navigation/leewayAngle.description: Leeway Angle derived from the longitudinal and transverse speeds through the water

/sar/*/navigation/trip/log.description: Total distance traveled on this trip / since trip reset

/sar/*/navigation/state.description: Current navigational state of the vessel

/sar/*/navigation/anchor.description: The anchor data, for anchor watch etc

/sar/*/navigation/anchor/maxRadius.description: Radius of anchor alarm boundary. The distance from anchor to the center of the boat

/sar/*/navigation/anchor/position.description: The actual anchor position of the vessel in 3 dimensions, probably an estimate at best

/sar/*/navigation/datetime.description: Time and Date from the GNSS Positioning System

/sar/*/navigation/datetime/gnssTimeSourc.description: Source of GNSS Date and Time

/sar/*/notifications.description: Notifications currently raised. Major categories have well-defined names, but the tree can be extended by any hierarchical structure

/sar/*/notifications/mob/method.description: Method to use to raise notifications

/sar/*/notifications/fire/method.description: Method to use to raise notifications

/sar/*/notifications/sinking/method.description: Method to use to raise notifications

/sar/*/notifications/flooding/method.description: Method to use to raise notifications

/sar/*/notifications/collision.description: In collision with another vessel or object

/sar/*/notifications/collision/method.description: Method to use to raise notifications

/sar/*/notifications/grounding/method.description: Method to use to raise notifications

/sar/*/notifications/listing/method.description: Method to use to raise notifications

/sar/*/notifications/adrift/method.description: Method to use to raise notifications

/sar/*/notifications/piracy.description: Under attack or danger from pirates

/sar/*/notifications/piracy/method.description: Method to use to raise notifications

/sar/*/notifications/abandon/method.description: Method to use to raise notifications

/sar/*/notifications/RegExp.description: This regex pattern is used for validation of the path of the alarm

/resources.description: Resources to aid in navigation and operation of the vessel including waypoints, routes, notes, etc.

/resources/charts.description: A holder for charts, each named with their chart code

/resources/charts/*/tilemapUrl.description: A url to the tilemap of the chart for use in TMS chartplotting apps

/resources/charts/*/region.description: Region related to note. A pointer to a region UUID. Alternative to geohash

/resources/charts/*/geohash.description: Position related to chart. Alternative to region

/resources/charts/*/chartUrl.description: A url to the chart file's storage location

/resources/charts/*/scale.description: The scale of the chart, the larger number from 1:200000

/resources/charts/*/chartLayers.description: If the chart format is WMS, the layers enabled for the chart.

/resources/charts/*/bounds.description: The bounds of the chart. An array containing the position of the upper left corner, and the lower right corner. Useful when the chart isn't inherently geo-referenced.

/resources/routes.description: A holder for routes, each named with a UUID

/resources/routes/*.description: A route, named with a UUID

/resources/routes/*/distance.description: Total distance from start to end

/resources/routes/*/start.description: The waypoint UUID at the start of the route

/resources/routes/*/end.description: The waypoint UUID at the end of the route

/resources/routes/*/feature.description: A Geo JSON feature object which describes the route between the waypoints

/resources/routes/*/feature/geometry/coo.description: An array of two or more positions

/resources/notes.description: A holder for notes about regions, each named with a UUID. Notes might include navigation or cruising info, images, or anything

/resources/notes/*.description: A note about a region, named with a UUID. Notes might include navigation or cruising info, images, or anything

/resources/notes/*/description.description: A textual description of the note

/resources/notes/*/region.description: Region related to note. A pointer to a region UUID. Alternative to position or geohash

/resources/notes/*/position.description: Position related to note. Alternative to region or geohash

/resources/notes/*/geohash.description: Position related to note. Alternative to region or position

/resources/regions.description: A holder for regions, each named with UUID

/resources/regions/*.description: A region of interest, each named with a UUID

/resources/regions/*/geohash.description: geohash of the approximate boundary of this region

/resources/regions/*/feature.description: A Geo JSON feature object which describes the regions boundary

/resources/waypoints.description: A holder for waypoints, each named with a UUID

/resources/waypoints/*.description: A waypoint, named with a UUID

/resources/waypoints/*/feature/geometry/.description: A single position, in x,y order (Lon, Lat)

/version.description: Version of the schema and APIs that this data is using in Canonical format i.e. V1.0.0.
